title: Fluid flow ratio of speeds in pipe

content.question: Water flows to the right in the cylindrical pipe shown in the figure. At Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the diameter of the pipe is <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> and the water flows with speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. At Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the diameter of the pipe is <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> and the water flows with speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is equal to the ratio <math alttext="v sub 1 to v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
